Work

PayScale

I work as a Senior Software Design Engineer at PayScale helping to modernize the design, code, and infrastructure for their product MarketPay.

Projects

  • MarketPay

IBM

I worked at IBM as a full stack DevOps software engineer. I built new features for and maintained the Digital Marketplace Storefront and Digital Marketplace Search UI.

Projects

  • IBM Digital Marketplace
  • IBM Digital Marketplace Search UI

UNC-Chapel Hill

While working on my MSIS at UNC-Chapel Hill, I worked as a Research Assistant. Below are some of the projects I worked on during my time at UNC.

Projects

  • AnnotatorOne Prototypes
  • MyBCRisk.org Responsive Website
  • NC Hospital Charges Visualization
  • Usability Evaluation: UNC Lifetime Library
  • Usability Evaluation: UNC Advising Site
  • Masters Paper

Etix

I worked at Etix as the sole front-end engineer from mid-2012 to mid-2013. I did some designing, some usability testing, a whole lot of refactoring of user interface code, and worked a little bit on some Java code in a J2EE web app that ran on Tomcat.

Projects

  • Style Guide
  • Checkout Process Redesign
  • Wireframes
  • Schema.org Metadata Implementation

Lowe's Home Improvement

I worked at Lowe's Home Improvement as a front-end developer from 2010 to 2012. I created new landing pages for the site, worked on the home page ocassionally, created bookmarklets for internal use by coworkers, worked on a proof of concept for integrating Flickr photos and Google maps, and mentored other developers. I was part of two different Agile teams at different times while I was there: first, as part of the Cart/Checkout team, and later as part of the Folders & Lists MyLowes team.

Projects

  • Lowes.com
